answers.answer: A markedly elevated blood pressure can lead to blurry vision and headache.  This should be addressed, and head imaging be done - either with a CT scan or MRI.I agree with the testing you have had.  Further testing would include an echocardiogram and/or Holter monitor to evaluate for any cardiac complaints.Imaging the carotid arteries for any blockages can be discussed as well.These options can be discussed with your personal physician.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.kevinmd_

question: I am 25 years old, overweight and recently tested for high bp (160/100).  For about a month I have non-stop dizziness and feeling faint.  The symptoms intensify at times making walking feel like it would cause me to pass out.  Sometimes it gets real bad even sittng and causes blurry vision.  Today I felt ok but even walking in the mall just increased pressure in my head and neck.  Other symptoms that occur sometimes are headaches and pain in different spots of my head, facial numbness/tingling, tightness or pressure on my neck.  I dont know if this is related but I also have not had solid stool even longer, and I have hair loss and dryness on my legs.  I thought this was new but then I remembered I got sick last spring after I worked out and felt very ill and an overwhelming feeling of passing out.  Also, the real onset seemed to be shortly after that after dinner one night something wasnt right in my head and working out has not truly happened since then and feel limited in my life.  Although this past month the symptoms are unrelenting.  Went to get checked out when it first came on--hit me walking to the bank, was not a pleasant feeling--diabetes, thyroid, anemia, ekg all negative, no inner ear or sinus issues, even though it has always been easy for me to get unbalanced.  Chest x-ray was normal, did find on a tilt table test that my hart rate goes up when moved up.  I was starting a new job so no insurance so some tests are delayed until I do get insurance (thankfully next week), any help would be great.
title: Feeling bad
